conclusion: Consider initial direction and speed of A, arrangement and size of blocks, effects of collisions and deflections.
A is entering from the right side of the image, moving towards the left.
Blocks are scattered across the green surface, varying in size and color, all cube-shaped.
When A collides with a block, it transfers momentum and may be deflected.
A is likely to collide with the first block it encounters as it moves leftward.
The first block in A's path appears to be a small blue block near the bottom right.
After colliding with the blue block, A may be deflected slightly upwards.
The next block in A's path could be an orange block slightly above and to the left of the blue block.
A will continue to collide with blocks, transferring momentum and being deflected.
A will eventually lose enough momentum to stop.
A will collide with blocks in sequence: small blue block, orange block, green block, red block.
A will eventually stop near the center of the image after colliding with several blocks.
